cellery

Class CellArray1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • cellery.CellArray1D

  • public class CellArray1D
extends java.lang.Object
    CellArray1D is a 1-d array of Cell objects which can kill or resurrect Cells and retrieve neighborhoods about individual Cells.
    Author:
    Zach Tidwell

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int length 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected CellArray1D(Cell[] cells)
      Instantiates a CellArray1D from a Cell[]
        CellArray1D(int length)
      Instantiates a CellArray1D of length containing only dead Cells.
        CellArray1D(int[] intArray)
      Instantiates a CellArray1D from an array of integers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cell getCell(int i)
      Retrieves the Cell at position i.
      CellArray1D getNeighbors(int i, int r)
      Retrieves the CellArray1D containing the Cells about the i-th Cell in a symmetric neighborhood of radius r.
      protected static Cell[] initializeCells(int[] intArray)
      Initializes a Cell[] from an integer array.

      Kills the Cell at position i

      Computes the number of living Cells in this.

      Gives an array of binary Values corresponding to the Cells in this.

      Translates this into a String containing binary integers representing the Cell states of this.

      • CellArray1D

        public CellArray1D(int length)
        Instantiates a CellArray1D of length containing only dead Cells.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • initializeCells

        protected static Cell[] initializeCells(int[] intArray)
        Initializes a Cell[] from an integer array. A living Cell is placed in the index corresponding to a value of 1 in the input integer array and dead cells are placed everywhere else.
        Parameters:
        intArray - the input array.
        Returns:
        the array of Cells generated by input array.

      • getNeighbors

        public CellArray1D getNeighbors(int i,
                       int r)
        Retrieves the CellArray1D containing the Cells about the i-th Cell in a symmetric neighborhood of radius r.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the center of the neighborhood
        r - the radius of the neighborhood
        Returns:
        CellArray containing the neighboring cells.

      • toBinaryArray

        public int[] toBinaryArray()
        Gives an array of binary Values corresponding to the Cells in this. 1 indicates that the Cell is alive and 0 indicates that it is dead.
        Returns:
        the binary array represented the states of Cells in this

      • livingCells

        public int livingCells()
        Computes the number of living Cells in this.
        Returns:
        the number of living cells in this.

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int i)
        Retrieves the Cell at position i.
        Parameters:
        i - index of the cell.
        Returns:
        the Cell at position i.

      • killCell

        public void killCell(int i)
        Kills the Cell at position i
        Parameters:
        i - the position of the Cell

      • reviveCell

        public void reviveCell(int i)
        Revives the Cell at position i.
        Parameters:
        i - the position of the Cell.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Translates this into a String containing binary integers representing the Cell states of this.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
